usefulItems: casserole dish, aluminium foil, ovenproof dish, oven, hob
title: Beef Rendang

ingredients.content: 1000 g stewing steak, cut in pieces (3 cm)
2 fresh lemon grass, white part only, cut in pieces
15 g fresh root ginger, peeled, cut in round slices (2 mm)
15 g fresh galangal, peeled, cut in round slices (2 mm)
½ bunch fresh coriander, leaves only

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 160°C. Heat oil in a heavy-based ovenproof dish and brown beef on a medium-high heat.
Place coriander seeds, cumin, fennel, salt and peppercorns in mixing bowl then grind <b>15 sec/speed 10<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place onions, garlic, lemongrass, chillies, ginger, galangal and water in mixing bowl, chop <b>10 sec/speed 6<b> then cook <b>5 min/120°C/speed 1<b>.
Transfer onion mixture to dish with beef, add coconut cream and reserved ground spices then stir well with spatula.
Bring to the boil, reduce heat to a simmer and stir in tamarind.
Cover with foil or lid and cook in oven for 2-2½ hours (160°C) until beef is tender.
Sprinkle with coriander leaves and serve with steamed rice.

hintsAndTricks: Vegetable or coconut oil may be substituted for peanut oil.
If there is liquid remaining after the beef is tender, transfer beef to a bowl, add liquid to mixing bowl then, without measuring cup, cook <b>3 min/120°C/speed 1<b>,<b> or until reduced by half.
This dish lasts very well and can be refrigerated when cooled.
